results.title: Days I'll remember in South Australia
results.creator_credit: Howard Rubie, Peter Dimond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The star quality of the state of South Australia and one of its daughters, Julie Anthony, is revealed in this prestigious tourist film. Specially conceived music, and superb visuals combine to present the major tourist attractions of South Australia. The River Murray, Port Lincoln, the Barossa Valley, the Adelaide Hills, the Flinders Ranges, and the city of Adelaide are featured. Julie Anthony’s singing adds a special dimension to the whole film

results.title: Betty: a shop steward
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Betty, from a Scottish working-class background, is a shop steward who plays a strong role in improving conditions at the factory in which she works. Intended to look critically and personally at the stereotype of the “pommy troublemaker” unionist, the film also raises other questions about working women.

results.title: Tor Schwanck: gold and silversmith
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”
Metal-work has been in Tor Schwanck’s family since the 15th century. He is an artisan trained in all aspects of metal-work. Schwanck uses non-precious metals as well as gold and silver. All the designs are originals, and he tours, exhibits and receives commissions for his work.

results.title: Sir Robert Helpmann
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
Sir Robert Helpmann trained with the legendary ballerina Anna Pavlova and had a successful career in musical comedy in Australia before travelling to England where he became a star of both the “Sadler’s Wells Ballet” and the “Old Vic.”. Helpmann remembers his association with Ninette de Valois and his first meeting with Margot Fonteyn, the beginning of a twenty-seven year partnership. Helpmann combined his successful international career in ballet, theatre and film with his commitment to the development of the “Australian Ballet”. He discusses the background to his ballet, “The Display” and his collaboration with Rudolf Nureyev on the film of “Don Quixote”. As a dancer, choreographer, actor and director Sir Robert Helpmann has made a unique contribution to the performing arts in Australia.

results.title: Kakadu: Land of the Crocodile
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Wilderness is increasingly recognised as a scarce and vital commodity worldwide. In this video, Part 2 in a series of 6 documentaries, Val Plumwood, environmental philosopher and writer returns to Kakadu, where she was the victim of a terrible crocodile attack. Set against the steamy, intensely beautiful, backdrop of Kakadu National Park viewers share her thoughts on wilderness and wildlife. Accompanied by a Teacher’s Guide.

results.title: Hard work and hope: Australia's Italians
results.creator_credit: Equality Press and Italian Historical Society
results.brief_description: Designed to enable Australian Studies students appreciate the role of migrant labour in Australia. Focuses on the theme of work as experienced by Italian immigrants both before and after World War II. Photographs, newsreel footage and moving footage from the Italian Historical Society documents the contribution of Australia’s Italians to the community through their work. Accompanied by a 19p. Teacher’s Guide.

results.title: Margaret Barr
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
Margaret Barr first trained in the Denishawn style and went on to study with Martha Graham in New York where she developed her interest in choreography. She discusses the importance of stress in the Graham technique and how it differs from classical ballet. Research and interview conducted by James Murdoch.

results.title: The Future of Our Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journalism Resource Tapes”.
Creighton Burns, Editor of the Age and Harry Gordon former Editor in Chief of the Herald and Weekly Times discuss the current decline of the newspaper industry. They give their opinions and make their predictions as to the future of journalism and the newspaper houses.

results.title: Women in the workforce
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth De Rome and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: The claim that sex is destiny is thought by many to be ludicrous, yet in practice, is this actually the case? The express purpose of this film is to promote discussion of and around the conscious and unconscious barriers women have to face daily in the workforce.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth De Rome and Open Channel Productions
